New Records: Lautaro Martínez was the Copa América 2024 leading scorer with five goals.
Argentina won the title without Lionel Messi, breaking Colombia's 28-game international win streak dating back to February 2022.
Key Match Events: The match ended in a 1-0 victory for Argentina in extra time with a goal by Lautaro Martínez in the 112th minute.
Lionel Messi was substituted out in the 66th minute due to an ankle injury.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were the tournament favorites and never trailed during the competition.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina's victory without Messi was a significant achievement.
The match was marred by fan incidents causing delays and requiring medical attention.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans without tickets rushed the stadium, leading to delays and security concerns.
